Reviews.Title: “Traditional Venetian style and elegance”
Reviews.Author: 12345stars
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gritti Palace is a unique building that provides traditional Venetian style and elegance, located right next to the enchanting Grand Canal. It was built in 1525, and became the private residence of Andrea Gritti. The hotel has been modernised and offers all the facilities and services that should ensure a pleasant stay. The hotel is a 5-star hotel, but should actually only have 3 stars, as the atmosphere and service lag significantly behind here. Inside, the hotel seems a bit worn out, and sometimes the service is non-existing. However, the hotel restaurant deserves 4 stars, and sitting outside in the evening eating your dinner right at the Grand Canal is about as romantic as it gets. If you are going to Venice, Hotel Danielli is the place to stay and always will be.

Reviews.Title: “Just Go Have a Cocktail So You Can Say You Experienced It”
Reviews.Author: OahuHawaii
Reviews.Content: We had a room reservation at The Gritti for 4 nights...part of Starwood. The first night in town we had a room in a diff. local...by the Rialto. Went over to have a cocktail at The Gritti. It was VERY ornate...almost uncomfortable. Check in desk was SOOO unassuming...the staff was very aloft. Not really sure why...as they only WORK there. We were seated on the outside terrace, right on the Grand Canal. It WAS a lovely view. Waiter was VERY condescending...almost rude. My husband put him back into realty. He is waiter at a hotel....DUHHHH. The patrons around us ranged from ladies with their children, couples...some nicley dressed...MOST others in their American shorts, white sneakers and socks, etc. Most, it was clear, had just stopped by to see the place and we're not staying here. Surely, not what we wanted. We ordered 2 drinks...nothing special. Tab was $52. 00US before tip. Just a TAD high...don't you think? The entire place had a very cold feel to it. So, we went to the desk and told them we would NOT be staying the following night for the 4 nights. They said they would be charging us one night as a no show. Fine...whatever. Well, the joke was on them. MONTHS later...we have never charged the one night. Sometimes, places, regardless of their cost or their "class", do not turn out to be what you anticipated. This was one of those times. My recommendation is to stop by and have a just a cocktail, even though VERY overpriced. We would never stay here. It is NO "Palace". It is a glamourous rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic and very romantic”
Reviews.Author: purrdy3us
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here and the staff were very friendly, we were even upgraded to a canal view room we stayed for 4 nights. This is a very luxury hotel and we felt like royalty. The only reason I give this a 4* is because I feel that they should offer a small coffee pot which they don't and the cost of having one delivered to the room was 8 euro and 8 euro for the coffee which means 16 euro I think this was a total rip off and did spoil our stay :-( a hot drink in the morning is one of the things I look forward too. Most hotels of this grade offer coffee or tea in the room..So I was very disappointed. .

Reviews.Title: “BEST PALACE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mercedes0008
Reviews.Content: The experience of staying here is one in a kind, they still have furniture from hundred years ago, we had stayed in two different rooms and both were magnificent. This is a great luxury collection hotel every second we felt like royalty... Price is high for the stay and the restaurant, but worth every penny!!! it is a legendary property and the service is exquisite!!!.... Great location away from the crowds but close to everything! I would definitely stay here again and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “True Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeis0n
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights, it was high summer and the hotel was crowded. Still, the staff was very attentious and everything went very well. Impressive bedroom and bathroom. Postcard view from the restaurant by the canale. Just perfect location. I donÂ´t need to say more. Just strongly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “The room we had was 900 euros per night. Room was worth 300 Euros view 600 Euros!”
Reviews.Author: bootsyboy
Reviews.Content: Not a lot of point in writing this as the Gritti Palce closes in 3 weeks time for refurbishment. It will take 18 months to complete. 900 Euros per night For a room with no Wi FI plastic curtain around the bath for the shower no iPod dock etc. this room cost more than the equivalant room at the worlds no 1 hotel the George Cinq in Paris. What the prices will be after refurbishment I shudder to think. But what a view over the Grand Canal with singing Gondoleirs! Room 300 Euros view 600 Euros!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price to Overlook the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Cathyc7
Reviews.Content: There is nothing like staying on the Grand Canal. We had rooms on the second floor, overlooking the Grand Canal, which was mesmerising. Then we ate breakfast out on the terrace, looking at the Grand Canal-we could hardly get ourselves going to leave the view. The breakfast buffet was extensive and delicious. The rooms were very nice, the bathrooms will benefit from the renovation. I really hope the hotel doesn't lose its charm. The concierges were very helpful with restaurant suggestions and reservations. All in all, a lovely, expensive, but worth it, place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Grande Dame”
Reviews.Author: Linda_22003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gritti September 16-19. It was my husband's first time in Venice and my second, and I wanted the classic Venetian hotel experience. We were not disappointed. Yes, the hotel is in need of its upcoming renovation, but let's see how good you look when you're five hundred years old. (Smile). It is old fashioned elegance rather than modern chic, and I hope it will stay that way. Our room was not on the canal, and we appreciated the total quiet at the back of the hotel. The staff was courteous, not obsequious, and gave wonderful restaurant recommendations. They took care of everything we wanted or needed instantaneously, and that's what you easily get used to with this level of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hope the renovation won't take too long: we will not visit Venice if we cannot stay in the Gritti!”
Reviews.Author: Hawet
Reviews.Content: In May last year we stayed for the first time in Gritti Palace (see my review of May 24, 2010), and we absolutely loved it!! Two weeks ago (September 17 and 18) we stayed there for the second time, and it was even better, if that would be possible. The beautiful building, the friendliness and efficiency of the staff, the wonderful restaurant, the Bellini's on the superb terrace, our lovely room, the breathtaking view â€“ how could it be bettered? Apparently someone thinks it could, because the Gritti is in for a major renovation. We sincerely hope that will not take too long, since we will not visit Venice before we can stay in the Gritti again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: LJG123186275
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from our 3 night honeymoon at the Gritti Palace, Venice and our stay was truly exceptional. Located on the Grand Canal, we felt that we were in prime position to explore all of Venice while being quietly tucked away from the hoards of tourists. The outdoor restaurant/bar area was the perfect place to enjoy their delicious breakfast in the morning sun and equally a great place to soak up the stunning sights of the canal at night time with a glass of champagne. We were delighted at the little touches that the hotel went to, such as sending champagne and strawberries to the room, ensuring our honeymoon was special. The other exceptional quality of this hotel was the service level received from the staff. They couldn't have been more helpful when we asked for a recommendation for a cheaper 'locals' restaurant. The place recommended was simply excellent and located within a 5 minute walk to the hotel. The same fantastic level of service was received throughout our entire stay whether it be booking water taxis or help with directions. Having recently stayed in a suite at The Savoy Hotel,London which has been excellently restored to its former glory, comparatively (price wise) the Gritti didn't quite come up to scratch. This was only down to the outdated bathrooms and tired furnishings. However I understand that renovations are soon to take place and my husband and I await with great anticipation to see this beautiful jewel polished up and sparkling again.

Reviews.Title: “A magic experience in this hotel of worldwide class”
Reviews.Author: Arbre_Sage
Reviews.Content: We decided to make a short city trip to Venise, arriving a Thursday at the end of the afternoon, and leaving the Saturday at the end of the morning. We choose the Gritti Palace, since we heard about this hotel from TV reportages and films. The hotel is facing a very strong reputation, and we wanted to check ourselves. My opinion is that this hotel is definitly one of the best - for all and everything : restaurant, situation, service, rooms, etc. Run by Starwood, the hotel is ideally situated at the heart of Venise, with an entry point on the Grand Canal, and another one by walk on the side --- no-one knows this passage, fortunately not the tourists, meaning that you don't have in the hotel tons of tourists just coming to 'visit' and 'see' the hotel (as opposed to the rival Danieli, where tourists can enter and visit the lobby, disturbing the hotel ambience). At walking distance, you find the famous Place Saint Marc, the Rialto bridge, and all the things that you usually want to visit when staying in Venise. Service at the hotel is great ; you can basically ask for anything and they will try (and generally succeed) to satisfy you ; as an example, the concierge service helps us managing our stay there, by booking things for us, and showing us the rights ways to go. The restaurant - which is on the Grand Canal - offers exceptionnal foods and beverages, but at very high costs ; you pay for the food, sure, but also for the situation, the reputation, the image, etc --- when dining at the candle light, you will face tourists taking pictures of you dining on the terrasse on the Grand Canal, as it is simply exceptionnal since no other place offers this possibility in Venise, not even the rival Danieli hotel. The room we took had a view on the Grand Canal, with a small balcony ; the room has a pure old-Italian look style, but for this place, you cannot expect something else, right ? The bathroom was OK, nothing more. Until the end of the night, you hear 'gondoles' singers from the Grand Canal, and this is just magic : being in your bed, or on the balcony, and hearing Venise at your feets is just smothing you need to experiencer at least one time in life. On the other side, my opinion is that the price is perhapstoo high compared to other 5-stars modern palaces ; I think that you pay for the situation, and the name. All in all, and despite the fact that it is probably to expensive, I noted this experience as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Tangar1
Reviews.Content: A wonderful week, in a wonderful hotel in a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: carolStockport
Reviews.Content: I have rarely been more disappointed by a hotel...Our deluxe room looked out onto a concrete wall, and we had to stand in a bath to have a shower. We were shown several other rooms, it was explained that a superior room meant to them a simple room, and it was no comfort in the fact that they were going to revamp the hotel in the Autumn!! Breakfast was included though I noticed on the menu it was priced at 52 euros, for what was a very lack lustre meal. We therefore decided not to dine there in the evening. The only upside of the hotel was the lovely veranda outside. Having said all this the staff were excellent and extremely friendly, of that I have no complaint. Even the transport they laid on to the hotel was a farce, but they did quickly give me a partial refund. No I would not return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: cacollins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a romantic long weekend. It is a nice hotel in a great location. The best part of this hotel is the breakfast served on the terrace on the Grand Canal. You could sit here all day to watch the boat traffic. The only downside is the cost, it is extremely expensive at about $50 per person. Because we are Starwood Gold we got upgraded to a newly refurbished room.. The hotel is going to be closed for 18 months starting this fall for a complete overhaul. They told us our room was an example of how the new rooms would look (see pictures attached). The room was opulent with silk for wall paper, Murano glass chandelier, paintings and old style furnishings. The bathroom was huge for Venice, done completely in marble with a shower and a soaking tub.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Venice”
Reviews.Author: Nome_1_11
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at gritti palace. The staff couldn't have been more polite and helpful, the rooms although old are very comfortable and beautiful. The reason i only gave it a four star rating was because of one of the waiters at the otherwise incredible bar which is right on the grand canal, was incredibly rude and patronizing ( it was the only dark spot on an otherwise wonderful stay).

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, historic site”
Reviews.Author: grannyjane18
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, old, historic hotel located on the Grande Canal. Very European in terms of service, ornate decor and facilities. Slightly worn look, although I believe it is scheduled for a face lift. Lunch on the Grande Canal was expensive but a wonderful experience. Breakfast on the Canal was included in our rate and was terrific. The only negative, in terms of service, occurred after we checked out. I left one shoe in the room and emailed the hotel when I got home. I never got any response.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Venice, marvelous experience”
Reviews.Author: TBC_59
Reviews.Content: The Gritti met all our expectations and more! Absolutely loved the place, location, decor, bar and restaurant (breakfasts were great with a very nice buffet). Service was discreet yet efficient. The location of the Gritti away from the crowds, yet within minutes of St Marc was perfect. And to top it all we were upgraded to a 3rd floor room with a Grand Canal view which made our Venice experience even more memorable. We are definitely looking forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “â€œOne of the best hotelsâ€�”
Reviews.Author: MarioApostolov
Reviews.Content: It has wonderful location, but I do not understand what the problem with the service is? When you hear 5 stars you imagine a hotel without any kind of problems. What happened to us is that we overslept and missed the official hours of the breakfast, it was around 11 oâ€™clock. We wanted to have something small to eat anyway in return for additional payment. In response we got that the kitchen will open earliest at 12:30. Besides this I couldnâ€™t complain about anything else maybe only that the prices should be around 30% lower. I recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “The Gritti IS Venice”
Reviews.Author: Linniepick
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a visit to the Gritti with my 10 year old grand daughter. I had taken her mother, my daughter, to the Gritti when she was 15 and she still says is the most magical hotel in which she has ever stayed. That magic is still alive. We stayed in a Venician 700 style room and called it our â€œprincess room.â€� Every member of the staff went out of his or her way to make sure we were taken care of - and I observed that they did this with every guest. Dinner and breakfast on the Grand Canal were beyond compare both in the food and the view - food for thought! They even have a special childrenâ€™s menu. My granddaughter begged to eat every meal there she loved it so much. I also appreciated that they have access to another hotelâ€™s gym (very important to me) so I was able to hit the treadmill in the morning before enjoying another blissful day of Italian food and wine! We were also able to take a private water taxi affiliated with the Hotel over to the Lido Beach one afternoon for a swim at the Excelsior Hotel which was wonderful. A perfect treat after hours of morning sightseeing and dealing with the July crowds. To me, the Gritti IS Venice and no other hotel can compare. When I returned home, I told my husband we needed to go back together soon. However, I have just learned that they are closing this fall for renovations. I am not sure how long this will take, but I do know that when they reopen, I want to be there!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Venice”
Reviews.Author: DamonH0330
Reviews.Content: The Gritti Palace is a wonderful property overlooking the grand canal. The hotel staff are very attentive and comfortable assisting their guests who's Italian is limited. The rooms and suites were well appointed providing enough space for our family needs. Internet was provided in each room, but the only wireless was in the lobby area. The breakfast provide each morning was more than adequate, however, the view enhanced the eating experience. The location is outstanding, a host of dining and shopping experiences are within easy walking distance, as well as St. Marks Square. Water taxis or gondolas are park right outside of the building (NO DRAGGING YOUR BAGS THROUGH VENICE!!!). If you are looking for an old world experience with new world amenities, I would recommend you consider Gritti Palace. Heyward Damon, Jr. President & CEO Damon Executive Event Planners, LLC

Reviews.Title: “They Left Our Luggage Sitting Out”
Reviews.Author: duclosmi
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect with our stay until after we checked out. We were spending the day in Venice and not leaving until the 11:30 p.m. train. The front desk staff said we could leave our luggage at the hotel for the day and that they would put it in their "locked" luggage room where it would be "safe" until we came back to get it. Around 8:30 - 9:00 p.m. we returned back to the hotel to have a drink at the bar. I was shocked to discover all three of our suitcases and my large Louis Vitton tote sitting by the door to the water taxi dock unsupervised and not "locked up or safe". I stood there for a few minutes to see if a hotel employee had just stepped away, etc. but no one ever appeared. When I complained at the front desk and showed them our bags left sitting there, I was given some lame excuse about how the porter must have taken them out so that they would be ready for us. I pointed out that: 1 - we didn't ask him to, 2- he did not know when we were returning, 3 - no one was watching them, and 4- we were there earlier than necessary. At anytime, anyone could have walked off with all of our luggage which included thousand of dollars worth of clothes and shoes, my jewelry, a computer, a brand new (in the box) Louis Vuitton wallet, and my L.V. tote! In my opinion, this is totally unacceptable, irresponsible, and will forever taint my opinion of this hotel. On my next trip to Venice, I will stay at the Hotel Danieli.

Reviews.Title: “A view to die for”
Reviews.Author: dagger17
Reviews.Content: We visited the Gritti Palace at the end of a Canal Trip from Amsterdam to Budapest having flown in to Marco Polo airport. The trip from the airport in the water taxi was an experience in itself and the water taxi pulled up right outside the door of the hotel on the Grand Canal. Attention to detail was evident from the time you walked through the door and whilst we only stayed 2 days we were looked after the whole time. We even called back at our room mid afternoon on the 2nd day because we were hot and tired from sightseeing since 8.30am and wanted to freshen up and a member of staff called at the room to ensure we were okay. The hotel is expensive but so is most of Venice and if you want a luxury experience I can only recomend it. Dining is a wonderful experience sitting on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and watching the world go by on the water in front of you.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: DianaDalek
Reviews.Content: Expensive hotel, but worth every Euro. Service was superb and friendly and the location was perfect. Rooms were large and well appointed. I would be very unlikely to go to another hotel when next in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: medano111
Reviews.Content: Well the Gritti Palace is one of those hotels for connoiseurs that is a must in the lifetime of a traveller. Classic and elegant, very discreet attention from the extremely helpful staff, and we had a beautiful Grand Canal room. We would wake up in the morning listening to the gondolieri singing in the Grand Canal, and the first thing you would see when you open the window is the Santa Maria della Salute church across the Canal. Everything was impeccable and we will definitely return when the hotel opens again after refurbishment (in a couple of years I think). I could not emphasize enough how much of a must this hotel is for the discerning traveller.

Reviews.Title: “A 40th Birthday Trip I'll Never Forget”
Reviews.Author: Travels4workand4fun
Reviews.Content: In kicking-off my 40th birthday celebration in Venice, we chose the Hotel Gritti Palace. I used SPG points to reserve four nights in a deluxe double room and was upgraded based on my Platinum status at check-in to a one bedroom suite (Room 325), which overlooked a quiet campo and church at the rear of the hotel. The room consisted of a large foyer, living room furnished with vintage and reproduction antiques and Murano glass wall sconces; a large walk-in closet provided plenty of storage, and the marble bath had double vanities with a large tub/shower, bidet, and towel warmer. The bedroom was also large, with a sitting area and antique writing desk. Windows offered a quite view of rooftops and balconies on adjoining residences. In addition to receiving a nice bottle of Valpollicello wine from the general manager, as a SPG Platinum guest, we were allowed to choose from a variety of additional amenities, so we chose a nice white wine selection as well. The first night there were local chocolates in the room, and at turn-down each night, we received Venetian gelatin candies. Internet was also free as a Platinum guest. The breakfast buffet is expensive at >50 Euros per person, but is fantastic, with hot and cold European style selections, an amazing array of pastries, and very nice prosecco. The breakfast dining room staff learn your preferences for coffee, tea, etc. on the first day, and no need to ask on future days. That's the level of service we encountered at every turn, from the front desk to the concierge. Cocktails on the Grand Canal each evening at Bar Longhi were a treat - the waiters are formal and unobtrusive (not aloof - you just need to signal when you're ready for your next drink - they will not intrude on conversations or quiet contemplation of the scenery going by on the canal). Lunch and dinner at Club del Doge were superb, again on the expensive side, but no more than a fine Manhattan restaurant, and a spectacular view across from the looming dome of the Salute. We took advantage of the Gritti's transfer service, which offered a personal airport greeting and water taxi transfer, which was again expensive, but worth every penny, especially after such a long flight. On check-out, we again used this service for transfer to our cruise ship. Our english-speaking escort was fantastic - due to crowding at the main water taxi landing, we were taken to a quite landing right at the bow of our ship, where cruise ship personnel directed us "the back way" to the check-in area. The Gritti is closing temporarily in November for an extensive renovation which, according to the front-of-house staff, will upgrade electronics (the old-style B&O TVs were once state of the art), safety, waterproofing, etc., but will preserve the fine character of the hotel with it's historic decor. Many of the staff were going to assignments at other properties in Italy or abroad in the interim. Despite other reviews to the contrary, no one seemed forlorn or withdrawn because of this. I will definitely look forward to be welcomed back to the Gritti when the renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and Eccentric Room”
Reviews.Author: slhokie
Reviews.Content: Our room was right by the elevator. The first thing different is that it had two front doors with an air space between them. Then, it had steps up to the window and a desk area. The walls had a delightful painted floral design. The breakfast area is a great terrace with a fantastic view. The service was superior and the location is near St Marks and the opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Gritti Palace is a good choice”
Reviews.Author: lastresortname
Reviews.Content: The Gritti Palace is a good choice for a hotel. It is a little further away from the crowds than the Danieli. The crowds can be overwhelming. The Gritti is in a great location, with a restaurant that has the best view possible. Even Angelina Jolie frequented this place for breakfast. The rooms are very nice. The Venetian style room type, is ornate and stunning. But very dark, and lots of rugs, drapery to collect dust. We changed to a regular room after 2 nights in the Venetian style room. My only warning is, if you open your windows to get air or light, BEWARE, that pigeons will fly in. That is scary, when you don't expect it. Overall I recommend the Gritti. Perfect location , easy walk to everywhere. Clean, excellent. I highly recommend. TIP: Take a private water taxi when you return to the airport. It is faster, and avoids the hassle of dragging your luggage, over several bridges ( steps).

Reviews.Title: “One of the world,s finest”
Reviews.Author: warlok7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Europe at least 2x a year and stay at. Some of the best hotels available. We've been to Venice at 12x and have stayed at "The Gritti" every time. We would not even consider staying anywhere else. It offers the best of old world Europe. We can even enjoy our electronics on the deck while I smoke a fine cigar.

Reviews.Title: “Old-world Elegance and remarkable service”
Reviews.Author: rogerad
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed five nights at the Gritti Palace, and we had a fantastic time. The front desk crew and concierge made us feel like royalty when we checked in. All the recommendations were spot on. We had a tricky train reservation to be made for Lake Como, and the concierge made all the arrangements for me. The day we were checking out, there was a vaporetto strike, and there were not many taxis around. I started feeling stressed out we wouldn't make it to the train station on time. Michel, the concierge on duty, told me not to worry that it was "his problem - not mine," and he would get us there on time. I went on to see this young man pace back and forth with a telephone calling several dispatchers. Needless to say, he got us there. The location couldn't be better. You're right on the Grand Canal - and it's quite a haven from the tourist crowds. The bar is the best spot for a late night-cap in all of Venice. Staying here is not cheap, but it's worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeet024
Reviews.Content: The Positives: -great location by the Grand Canal -well appointed historic room -check in agent very helpful & escorted us to our room -breakfast buffet selection pretty good & great seating on the water -room attendant was friendly & cheerful -beautiful building The Negative: -service was spotty. I stood in front of two concierge attendants for at least a couple of minutes. They appeared to be arguing & completely ignored me until I excused myself & asked for directions.

Reviews.Title: “There is nothing palatial about the Gritti Palace”
Reviews.Author: FilsProdigue
Reviews.Content: i checked out of the Gritti this morning after a 3 night stay. To say our visit was disappointing would be a gross understatement. I was hosting family for a post wedding visit and was embarrassed after having built it up as something special. * The Grand Canal location is wonderful and the staff is reasonably friendly --- that is all. There were occasions where we called the front desk and there was no answer and we had to bring our own bags down because no one was available; * The decor is not antique --- its old and tired;"baby blue" walls and shower curtains that don't fit.The building could not have possibly been remodeled in the last 30 or 40 years. There is absolutely NOTHING luxurious about this property. Our television didn't work when we arrived. * The rooms are not independently climate controlled i.e. you can keep windows closed and bake or keep them open and be eaten by lagoon mosquitos; * Breakfast is 48 Euros for the buffet (we paid 660 Euros with breakfast included) and a bottle of water is 9 Euros i.e. about $13.00; * Internet is 15 Euros i.e. 23.60 per day. My recommendation is to book in advance, off the canal (eat there for breakfast or lunch) and make sure you have air and modern ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “A slighty shabby delight!”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre- cruise and had an absolute ball. We booked water taxi transfers via the hotel concierge both ways and â€“ while expensive â€“ donâ€™t regret a penny as it was entirely hassle free. Our experience of the concierge was first class with great communication on transfers and dinner reservations. Because we were arriving in the evening we decided to opt for an ordinary room and I wouldnâ€™t do that again. Really very tired and not classic or even shabby chic â€“ just a bit shabby. Stupid things like a very ugly and marked bathroom ceiling and dull â€˜brownâ€™ furniture just jarred when you are paying so much. I just read a previous post saying the hotel is to be renovated from November and about time too. If you are going before I would splurge on a view. That aside however we simply adored the location, delighted in sitting on the terrace drinking prosecco and watching the world go by in luxury and our dinner in the Club del Doge was delicious with fantastic service.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm, Great View, but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: glenn1_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gritti Palace May 12-14 using SPG points. We got a nice, small room but not a palacial room, possibly due to 'free' room. The room had antique furniture and had the feel of an old palace room. Unfortunately our room had no view. The Gritti is small, which made it quiet and relaxing, compared to the Westin Europa a short walk away. It has its own dock for the water taxi and a Gondola service next to the property, and if you want to use the Vaporetti to get around, it is less that 100yds away. The restaurant uses the veranda overlooking the Grande Canal in good weather. We really enjoyed the view. But, be aware that the Hotel and restaurant is pricey, and they charge an 8.50Euro coperta (cover charge) per person to occupy a table for lunch. For lunch we each had the ravioli and a glass of wine. The ravioli were the best that we have ever had, but then they should be at roughly $50 for 5. We thought that the coperta was excessive, since we were staying there. Like several of the other reviewers, I found the male concierge and other help somewaht snobbish. The published rate for this weekend is 708Euros/night, so I take it that if you have to ask about cost, you should not stay here. There are many good charming restaurants to choose from within a short walk at 1/3 the price. You don't get a view of the canal, but you get good food. I got advice on how to get to the hotel, cruise terminal, and rail station from TripAdvisor before leaving. In Venice it is either by water or walk. We tried the Vaporetti to get to the hotel from St Lucia station. We had one large suitcase and a carryo-on bag and it did not work out well. The Vaporetti are crowded and used by tourists and locals to get around cheaply. I would not do it again with luggage, The same with Allilaguna to go from St Mark's to cruise terminal. If you can afford the 70euro fare, take the water taxi. It picks you up at the Gritti and drops you at a pier where you check your luggage. If you take Allilaguna, you still have to tote your bags to your cruise line, which is several hundred yards.

Reviews.Title: “Well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: enr12
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here a couple of weeks ago, and enjoyed it very much. The room was very nice over looking the small canal in which the gondolas went by, so one could hear all the singing. Breakfast was beautifully set up over looking the Grand Canal. The hotel is located a few blocks from St Mark's sq. and is very centralized. It was conveniently located as the water taxi came right to the side of the hotel facing the Grand Canal. If one were there airport after picking up your luggage, you could pay for the water taxi by credit card around $100 Eur, and go out the door and turn left and follow the path for about 1/4 of a mile. Be sure to spend the .50 cents for the cart as it is a long way to the dock. No reason to making an advance booking or haing to pay extra to have a guide meet you. The service was good, and they extended an hour later for my check out as a gold card member of Starwoods.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Canal Grande view from our windows”
Reviews.Author: Hawet
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice on the day the Pope visited there, so we had a bit of trouble getting to the hotel. But after arriving, check-in was very fast, and we were taken up to our room in just minutes. We had a large room (212), with a very beautiful Murano chandelier. Good bed, good furniture. Rather small TV. Beautiful curtains. The bathroom was not very big, but decorated with beautiful red marble. Everything was spotlessy clean.There was a big bouquet of fresh roses in our room, and also Franciacorta prosecco and two boxes of chocolates. But the most important: THE VIEW! Venice is the most beautiful city in the world, and the Canal Grande view from our windows was so beautiful that we just couldn't get enough of it. We enjoyed the same view when we had drinks on the terrace downstairs (the best bellini's we have had for years!), and when we had breakfast there (there was a very good buffet). One night we had dinner in the hotel-restaurant Club del Doge (inside, because of the weather). Superlative food, and very good service! We also had very good service from the friendly waiter who brought us our drinks, and from the breakfast staff. It was all very special, and we certainly will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but would rather stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: LIESQ
Reviews.Content: At check in we were told we would be given a room upgrade. The room was pretty with an old world charm but the view overlooked a walled in alley. Dark all over. Our room also had a persistent moldy smell. I tried to lower the air conditioning but the thermostat didn't appear to work and nothing I did would cool the room. When I asked for assistance, a technician was sent to the room and he essentially told me that the temperature of all the rooms on the floor was controlled by the hotel and our room would not get any cooler. It was really warm. The concierge was not helpful during our stay and never smiled. Also, just as an aside... the hotel wanted to charge us 100 euros for a roll away bed. We negotiated them down to 80. Other 5 star hotels in Rome and Florence charged us 50. I did not feel pampered or particularly valued in this hotel and would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Sara41891
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 30th anniversary with a trip to Venice, and staying at the Gritti Palace was absolutely wonderful. The building itself is gorgeous, and the room with its huge windows and beautiful Murano chandelier was delightful. We were treated to complimentary champagne, chocolates and grappa in our room by the lovely staff. We found the staff to be very helpful and courteous, and not at all pretentious. The headwaiter at breakfast even printed out the weather predictions for the week for me, after I had made a passing comment about the clouds one morning. The best part of all about our stay was enjoying breakfast each morning on the terrace, which is right on the Grand Canal. Watching the huge assortment of boats going by, with the beautiful La Salute church in the background, was a lovely beginning to each day. The location is absolutely perfect--only a few blocks from Piazza San Marco (with a very pleasant walk down the best shopping street in Venice), but the hotel is tucked away down a little side street which is quiet--not much street noise at all. I highly recommend the Gritti Palace for a very memorable time in one of the loveliest cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “5 star??”
Reviews.Author: yvo28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in April - on our honeymoon. We decided not to splurge on a canal view as we were going on to Paris where we were planning to splash out, but we were disappointed that the room we were given, whilst a good size, looked out onto a dark courtyard and the room was really dark during the day so we had to have the lights on even though it was really sunny outside. Bit depressing. Also the bathroom was not in our view anywhere near 5 star (not having been upgraded since approximately 1983 by the looks of it). We were told that we had been given an upgrade because we were honeymooners.... We ended up just using the hotel to sleep in which seemed a bit of a waste of money. Suspect some of the rooms are amazing and the bar's terrace is obviously an amazing spot to have a drink, but you probably have to pay dearly for that so if you are trying to budget to some degree, you will probably get a lot more for your money elsewhere. The service was ok but we encountered a grumpy barman on our first night who was very unwelcoming because we wanted a drink just before midnight - not brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “uneven service and NOT a museum”
Reviews.Author: L1NUS
Reviews.Content: After having read some guides I had pictured this hotel as being something in between a hotel and a museum. This is not the case at all - they have some old furniture, carpets and some paintings but nothing fancy at all. Stayed for 3 nights and experienced the service as being very diverse. 1 out of 3 people at the concierge desk offered decent 5-star service whereas the other two rolled their eyes and/or turned away when asked to help with a dinner reservation or similar. (and I do tip - americanstyle) At the reception on the other hand the service was truly 5 star as was the housekeeping, a sharp contrast to the hostess at breakfast who resembled the grouch in my high school cafeteria. The Grand Canal view did however make up for this bigtime.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull Hotel, Service outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: blackjeepguy
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in the Gritti for a few days for vacation - hotel, room, and service were outstanding! Great location for everything you want to do in in Venice. The front desk and concierge were extremely nice and helpful. Arrive by water taxi for a truly great experience. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Amazing Gritti”
Reviews.Author: GloucesterCromar
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel where the service was spot on. We were looked after very well. My birthday, which I had not mentioned, was marked with a bottle of bubbly. The terrace overlooking The Grand Canal is a great plave for coffee or breakfast. The buffet breakfast is generous, regularly replenished and more than enough to see you through to supper. Not as expensive as you might expect if you book carefully and cannily. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: gary13smith
Reviews.Content: Hotel perfect,location fantastic,staff 10 out of 10,Venice magical,room 216 and views superb worth every penny/euro

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SusanLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I "won" 2 nights at the Gritti through a charity auction. Upon arrival, we were offered the opportunity to upgrade from a lovely small room overlooking the canal to a beautiful two-room suite overlooking the campo (at no charge). The rooms have murano glass fixtures, excellent linens and very comfy beds. the hotel is gorgeous and centrally located. The concierge helped us find whatever we needed. Breakfast (included with the room) is a typical Euro buffet - delicious with yogurts, meats, cheeses, fruit & pastries. We had cocktails on night, and lunch one day, right on the grand canal and it was extraordinary (and very expensive). On our 2nd night, the manager delivered a lovely bottle of Prosecco to our room. Truly tremendous service!! It is not cheap, but if you are looking to splurge this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Stay, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Chellebell
Reviews.Content: Was lucky enough to get to stay here for two nights. I had suite 406, overlooking the side canal. It was quiet and comfortable, the best sleep off my three week holiday. Because it's part of the SPG Luxury Collection and in expensive Venice, I expected the staff to be uppity...this couldn't have been further from the truth. Ms. Diana and Pierluigi were so warm and welcoming, the bellman, concierge, and restaurant staff could not have been kinder. Ever time I returned from exploring, I felt like I was coming home. When I left, I actually shed a tear. It was truly a beautiful stay. The breakfast was way too pricey, which is why I marked down on value. As SPG Platinum I usually get free or reduced breakfast. 99 Euro for two adults and 1 child was far, far too much. I would have given the room a five if wifi service had been available. It was nice to have it in the lobby, but I'd prefer to make travel arrangements and deal with business in my pajamas in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fiw320
Reviews.Content: My sister, my niece, and I began our recent trip with a stay at the Gritti. It was amazing. I had upgraded our rooms to a Canal View and the room and the views were spectacular! There was champagne and chocolate awaiting us on arrival. We arrived by water taxi from the airport at the Hotel's dock. The staff was wonderful, especially Roberta in the Reception area and the concierge Guiliano. They were very kind and helpful, answering our multiple questions and giving wonderful suggestions for our trip. We had lunch in their restaurant on the Canal terrace...the day was spectacular and so were the views. This was our second trip to Venice, but our stay at the Gritti Palace. I hope we get to plan another visit to this hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best of the 'old school' hotels”
Reviews.Author: JeffBarnes
Reviews.Content: Probably my fifth time to Venice but my first time at the Gritti - a 'special birthday' treat from my partner. The staff are very well trained and genuinely courteous and the hotel exudes a calmness and serenity that seems to seep from the very walls. Despite the age of the place everything works perfectly well and you couldn't hope for a better location. For the best stay ask for a Grand Canal view room and get up a few floors so the early morning canal traffic doesn't disturb your slumbers! Suggestions for places to eat - Harry's Bar for the best burger you will ever eat; Sangal for chic, modern Italian cuisine and Osteria Enoteca, San Marco for bistro style and fabulous wine - all within ten minutes walk of the Gritti. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Five star luxury”
Reviews.Author: Fahdamjad
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the interior of the hotel and the friendly staff. Gritti Palacen and Danieli are easily the best hotels in Venice - no doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjr666
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Gritti Palace for my birthday (Mid-February) and had an amazing experience. I used my StarPoints to book the room, but as far as the employees were concerned I paid full price and was not treated any differently than someone who actually paid for their rooms with actual cash. Being a Platinum Member, I received all the benefits which would be expected to include a room upgrade. We asked for a view, but of course there were none availalbe....BUT....our room lined a smaller canal and it was still very nice to have. From check-in to check-out we had an amazing experience. As we had notified that hotel that we were celebrating my birthday, we came home to find a nice bottle of sparkling wine in our room and a birthday note from the GM. Both the concierage and the front desk were extremly helpful and informative as this was my first trip to Venice. Lovely hotel, excellent staff, clearly a cut above a majority of hotels in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in my favorite city in the world”
Reviews.Author: LOCWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: I love everything about the Gritti Palace. The rooms, the service, the restaurant on the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Still One of My Favorites”
Reviews.Author: HopesandDreams
Reviews.Content: As historical hotels go, this one is still charming. First, it may not appeal to everyone. It has an old, upper crust, stuffy museum feel to it. I have been to this hotel several times, and have never seen more than three or four other patrons while there, as it is not a "hot spot" kind of place. If you are looking for a quiet, reserved, albeit expensive experience, then this is the place for you. I have experienced several different types of rooms, and they all have the same thing in common. Quite large SUITES, by European standards, with plush, luxurious touches throughout. (Thick robes, linen, damask curtains, chandeliers, rugs/flooring, beautiful antiques, ornate decorations). I did note that over the years, they have eliminated some of the hotels' signature features, opting for the Starwood Luxury Collection items instead, but this does not take away from the overall Hotel Gritti experience. Second, everything is top rate, including the service and the food, so be prepared to pay - it is Venice, you know! The rooms are lovely, the views are pleasant and the hotel is Old World Venice. It is not as opulent as the Danieli's Lobby, nor as modern as the Westin Europa, but in my opinion the nicest of the 3 Starwood hotels for the room experience. I have seen some rooms that did not have a separate area, but all that I experienced had hallways/entryways lined with closets (as part of the room) that led to the bedroom, with separate sleeping areas away from the bathroom, that helped with that larger feel. Yes, I did notice some areas needing touch-up, but I've also noticed that at every Venice hotel that I have stayed. I beginning to believe this more the charm of the Venice area, than a misfortune of the hotel. The hotel is extremely easy to get to, well located, right off the #1 line, before or after the San Marco exit - depending on the direction you are arriving, (with no bridges to cross - exit out of the walkway, turn right, walk down the square and you are there) or by water Taxi. Hotel Gritti is quiet, reserved, Old World elegance. If that is what you are looking for, then this hotel fits the bill perfectly!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: DCNI
Reviews.Content: Having read some less than complimentary reviews on the Gritti Palace my husband and I arrived with a touch of apprehension. We need not have worried. The hotel was wonderful. Elegant if a little bit worn with age - but in a good way. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. The bar staff were perhaps a little bit curt but not in any sense rude. The room we stayed in didn't have a view but it was beautiful and cleaned to perfection daily with full replenishment of the luxurious toiletries. It is expensive but no more than any other good 5 star hotel and worth every cent for our memorablestay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: piatty73
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and had a corner room on the grand canal. It was very nice and we enjoyed it more as the hours went by. The front office mgr, Mr Schultz was very helpful. We have always stayed at the Danieli and it still has the nicer lobby but we will return to the Griiti as well.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend at Gritti Palace”
Reviews.Author: DanSanders
Reviews.Content: We just took our mother to Venice for her 60th birthday and we are so happy that we booked this hotel because it took our weekend to the next level. It was very special; the hotel staff are just amazing at helping with all of the little details and we enjoyed chatting to them all. Breakfast is wonderful with delicious food and luxurious touches like a glass of champagne in the buffet breakfast. Location is wonderful - near some lovely places and away from the chaos of the Rialto area which we disliked for its crowds and gaudy shops. Concierge was wonderful & fixed us up with all manner of requests. It dents the pocket but it is soooo worth it. so if you want your weekend to be special and go with a bang book in here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting for a way too long overdue break from work”
Reviews.Author: Poirier15
Reviews.Content: the Hotel is just perfect for what we had in mind: relaxation in a quiet setting. The staff is EXCELLENT; the location of the hotel could not be any better (arriving by taxi boat right at the door) and not far from Piazza San Marco; the history of the building is fantastic. Venice in October was magnificent and Gritti Palace was the right choice! This hotel provides you with serious old type service (not outmoded): serious, intelligent, classy. great restaurants within walking distance (as everything is in Venice) We liked it so much that we plan to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Old school charm but steeply priced”
Reviews.Author: Singlelady18
Reviews.Content: The staff here were courteous and charming and the whole place had a traditional, rather formal, air about it. I always felt taken care of, even when I was alone in the bar. One nice touch was the musician in the bar each evening. The hotel is right next to a water bus stop so is very convenient to get to and the number 1 water bus (that goes along the Grand Canal) stops right nearby. On the downside, the whole place is rather dark (lots of marble and wood) and it is prone to flooding. And of course, the prices are very high. My room was a 'cozy room' which is a double room but really for single travellers. I found it rather claustrophobic and was glad I was only staying for 2 nights. I also stayed at the Westin Europa and Regina and have to say I preferred that one and felt it was better value as well.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ava10_8
Reviews.Content: This wonderfully elegant hotel, perfectly located on the Grand Canal with a traghetto crossing on its doorstep and moments from St Mark's, surpassed my expectations. Service was faultless and friendly. My first floor room was grand, tall windows overlooking the Campo Santa Maria del Giglio, the bed vast and extremely comfortable. Though I normally choose modern over traditional, to stay in Venice in the Gritti Palace's glamorous, gilded surroundings felt absolutely fitting. It felt like we'd stepped into the gentle grandeur of another century and I loved that.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely courteous and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dsharpe22
Reviews.Content: Just want to let you know how enjoyable our stay was at the Gritti Palace in Venice. The General Manage Mr. Lorenzoni along with his staff helped make our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Special birthday meeting”
Reviews.Author: tetene
Reviews.Content: Our stay has been magnificent. Our room with a beautiful view on the GRAND CANAL, and furnitures were tipically venitian. Services were excellent and restaurant was great. It is a little bit expensive but for a special day that's a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: AninhaG
Reviews.Content: Have your breakfast at the Grand Canal is one of several privileges of this wonderful Hotel. The Concierge service is something that makes the difference. The rooms are clean and chic! Just perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property if you like opulence”
Reviews.Author: horadam1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property on the tail-end of our cruise. I almost wish that we had more than one day to stay there! We booked the room through American Express Platinum. We received a beautiful, huge room with an outstanding view and a small balcony. In addition, we also had a complimentry tea on the terrace(great people watching.)The food served was delicious, and the service was perfect! Since we had to check out at 4:30am, the complimentry breakfast was delivered via room service. The location was terrific as well(kind of hidden away, but yet close to everything.) If I return to Venice, this will be my palace again. Thank you to the wonderful staff at this beautiful hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel. Old world style and class. Very old fashioned”
Reviews.Author: Webpuccino
Reviews.Content: Whenyou walk into this hotel, you know you are no longer in Kansas or at a W Hotel. This is a very classy hotel that tends to deal with clients whom are of our grandparent's generation. I did not see any young guests or couples checking in and all of the patrons of the lobby bar, Bar Longhi, were 60+ and very classy. This is a hotel where even handbags are given a chair to sit on. I guess if you are willing to pay 1500â‚¬ for a handbag, it deserves it's own chair. The hotel does not have wifi in the room and still has a telegram/telecom desk which is a sign of tradition. The hotel is on the Grand Canal just like the Regina and Europa. The batman at this hotel wearing his classy white suit is somewhat of a prude or snob and this appears to be consistent when I described the person to Venetians whom know the property. If you are longing to go to Bar Longhi, I recommend you dress for it or you will get the "snobbish lock of disapproval." The rooms are very tastefully decorated and large for Venice. You will find classic pink and yellow marble bathrooms with turn of the century cold and hot fixtures. All of the mirrors with the exception of the bathroom mirror are original and old and thicker at the bottom. The rooms are very quiet and you will not hear any heavy metal music or loud bands playing in your room. The tis still the old style with a tube and is quite small. I am not on the grand canal but along the side and if you hang out the window and look to the left, I too have a room with a view of the Grand canal. It appears that this can be done from any room that is not on the front of the hotel. The view from the lobby bar is quite nice and the same at the Westin Europa e Regina's Tiepolo Bar. I recommend skipping an experience with "lo snob" (the snob) and go to the Tiepolo Bar for a very genuine and warm welcome by Luanna and Aldo. Thereis no better Barista in Venice than them. Try a cappuccino shakerato. It is better than any Starbucks Frappuccino :) Service at the Gritti Palace is exceptional. the director, Paolo, runs the hotel like a ship and everything is done quickly and efficiently. The front desk is efficient and quick. The young hotel associate whom checked me in was vey friendly and open and friendly and shared with me his story of how much he loves to play drums and how this resulted in his carpal tunnel syndrome. Any request I had received immediate attention and Roberta helped me later that day to quickly resolve a problem. There is a gondola stand right outside the front door and the closest vapaoretto stop for the hotel is S Maria del Giglio and the hotel is down from the Bel Sito. Karen Brown writes about room 201 at the Bel Sito in her book on charming inns and rooms in italy. The gritti palace is one of 3 starwood properties in Venice. In ranked order, I prefer the Westin Europa e Regina to the Danieli to the Gritti Palace. The Westinhas the heavenly bed and now the heavenly bath with the double shower head. The Danieli has the impressive lobby and the rooms on the Grand Canal with balconies cannot be beat. The Gritti Palace has old world charm and caters to my grandmother's needs in a hotel. They are all beautiful five star properties. Also, the best kept secret is this: From the front door, you can take the cheapest gondola ride. You can take the traghetto from one side of the Grand Canal to the other for a very small fee. This could be the cheapest gondola ride you can take.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, comfort, view, luxury, location, perfect.......”
Reviews.Author: aloha25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gritti Palace on the Grand Canal in Venice, Italy. We were blessed with lovely weather (a plus in Venice) and a mid week stay of 5 nights. Our room was spacious, comfortable, well appointed, beautiful, wonderful......and a terrific location. Lots of history and style. The staff is superb. The concierge(s) are highly trained professionals and can help with the smallest and largest question. It was perfect. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “great as always”
Reviews.Author: jckmd
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the gritti the weekend of the redentore. we had a perfect view of the fireworks from our room. the griiti is eptiome of old world elegance. the room was beautiful and the staff extremely accomodating. it was our 3rd stay and look forward to the next. i love arriving at the airport or train and taking a water taxi right up to the gritti dock on the grand canal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Elainecde
Reviews.Content: I concur with previous reviews on how the Gritti is showing a little wear. We had our 7 year old with us. They charge 125 Euros for a rollaway, which seems a little steep, but then again, it is the Gritti. My only real complaint was with the shower. We got a 700 room so we would have a shower, which ended up being in the tub. That was ok, but the water pressure was great if you like deep tissue massages. If you don't you were out of luck. It also either ran cold or scalding. It was hard to get anything in between. While the sink/tub features might be quality, they looked ugly and old fashion. For the money, I think I'd try another hotel next time. Oh, they don't have a pool, but you can get a free shuttle to the Excelsior which charges 35 Euro a person or you can rent a cabana at the beach for a mere 350 Euros. If you go farther away, you can get to a free beach. We went and had 3 cokes for $50 in St. Mark's Sq. instead of going swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Completely overhyped, not at all worth the price... location the only positive thing”
Reviews.Author: bxlcpl
Reviews.Content: Went there for our 10 Year Anniversary, booked well in advance, informed them of our special occasion, but there was nothing special about the service, regardless of our occasion or that we have been SPG members for several years, couldn't even get an extra hour late check-out!!! Concierges except for one were rude and unhelpful, and one sold us up the river by booking a 60 euro water taxi to Piazzale Roma when the ride takes 5 mins.... normal rate for a water taxi is 13 euros and then 2 euros per minute or something so you can be SURE the concierges are getting some kickbacks!!! Location and views are great, but besides that, not a lot positive to say... completely overhyped, not at all worth the price. Room furnishings are antiquated and small... we weren't there of course to stay in the room but for example the television was old, several channels didn't work, called down and they sent someone up who did absolutely nothing, just blamed it on the heat (it was hot, but why were only certain channels not working then???)

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis Amidst The Chaos”
Reviews.Author: Napoli64
Reviews.Content: I rarely write such reviews, but felt compelled to so do with the hope that other like-minded travelers might benefit from my experience. In fact.. after scouring TripAdvisor reviews, I switched my original reservation from the Hotel Danieli (very near ground zero of total tourist mayhem) to the fabled Gritti Palace, and I am very grateful to those reviews which lead me to do so. First.. I am not dissing the Danieli. The buildings are lovely (even the neo-fascist 40s addition closest to the Doges Palace, looks oddly appealing). The challenge with the Danieli is that upon exiting the hotel lobby [which is superb BTW] you are met by a sea of humanity rivaled only by Times Square in NYC on New Years Eve. Hurried, loud, oppressive and not the least bit elegant or relaxing. The other horror of the Danieli, is the very real prospect of ENORMOUS (20 stories high) cruise ships gliding in to your sight line from within the hotel. Yes, Venice IS a cruise stop... but somehow stepping out of the Doges Palace and confronting a huge, floating building, the size of Vermont is disconcerting, to say the least. This is, after all, not Ft. Lauderdale. The Gritti on the other hand is mercifully tucked away a few blocks from the madness of Carnival Mask Tourist Traps and the Luxury Globally Branded Boutiques of Calle Larga 22 Marzo. On its own, quiet and pleasant campo, the Gritti is perfectly positioned on the Grand Canal/diagonally across from the Santa Maria della Salute and the Guggenheim Collection. Drinks on the Gritti's Grand Canal terrace are worth the trip alone. With slightly over 90 rooms... this is a smallish hotel (by American standards), but one with First Rate concierge, house keeping and reception services. Despite some of what I've read here to the contrary, my experience with the staff was prompt, courteous, and extremely helpful. Roberta and Guiliano were particular stand-outs among the Gritti's front room staff. The ambiance of the hotel is hushed, intimate and quietly faded with an Old Guard attitude, which I found totally endearing in light of the 21st Century's Global Corporate Sameness, - but younger people might just find it "old". The public rooms are handsomely appointed with (mostly) period Italian furnishings and fixtures. It's clear that the interior design and schemes have changed little in the past 50-60 years, but its still "current", clean and impeccably run. If you are used to Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons "up-to-the-moment luxury appointments and trend notes" with "statement" floral displays at every corner you may be disappointed; clearly, the Gritti targets a more subdued, worldly & genteel circle. As for the rooms... I was lucky enough to stay in two rooms, as I left and returned to Venice during my most recent trip. The first room was on the 4th floor. Very large with high, beamed ceilings, double built-in wall armoires and a nicely built-in desk unit + an enormous bed and beautifully upholstered headboard integrated into the boiserie walls. The room was accented by smoked mirror walls and handsome (albeit overly gilded) reproduction "Venetian" side chairs, table and bench, most likely from the 60s or 70s. Handsomely carpeted and a large window (with no view) - but beautifully draped and finished. The bathroom was quite large and "L" shaped with two separate "rooms" each with wall-mounted sinks and a sliding glass door dividing the two spaces. This bathroom was smothered in highly figured grey marble from floor to ceiling and obviously not really updated since the late 50s. BUT... so well designed and maintained, that it was wonderful. The second room was #215, fronting on the Grand Canal with a small balcony. Smaller than the earlier room on the 4th floor, this room was very pleasing, with its 16 foot ceiling and balcony with grand views.. but despite its premium canal location, this room was less spacious and cozy feeling; and the bathroom, though more "current" than the huge one on the 4th floor, was small, less functional and somewhat tired, by comparison. I was told by the reception upon leaving that #216 is a gem (and larger than the adjacent room in which I stayed). Housekeeping was exemplary and responsive. And despite now being owned and run by Starwoods, the Gritti seems to have maintained its independent tone and almost early/post-war sense of style and service. Though ZAGAT rates the Cipriani as the #1 hotel in the Venice (with the Gritti as #2), the Gritti's location is much more ideal, especially for easy walking access to the main island and sights. There are no quality hotels and restaurants in Venice that are inexpensive - so I would give earnest thumbs up to the Gritti. Drinks and meals are costly there, as are the rooms - but the quality of room amenities, services and the hotel's superior, almost private location in midst of unbridled chaos, are worth the extra expense!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: baci2003
Reviews.Content: The Gritti Palace is located right on the Grand Canal. So the location is great. I think the location is the best part of the hotel. If you get a room overlooking the Grand Canal I am sure it is fantastic. Staying at a hotel right on the canal is very important in Venice. If you do not stay directly on the canal you will be dropped off by the Water Taxi and you will need to walk up and down the bridges and streets with your suitcases in tow which would really be bad. Please bear in mind this hotel is rated by Starwood as a Category 6 Luxury Hotel. I do not believe it is accurate. The hotel seems at least 20 years out of date. The last renovation must have been in the early 90s so the rooms feel dated and by no means Luxurious. The bathrooms definitely need a renovation. The shower head was clogged and only a few of the spouts allowed water to come out. The TV was a 19 inch unit that strained our eyes. The bed and towels were not bad. Simple things that you expect in a Luxury Hotel like providing a daily bottle of water are not done. It is these simple things that make the hotel not feel like a Luxury Collection hotel. The Concierges are pretty good but you get the feel they are in cahoots with the Water Taxi drivers. For example, when we took a Water Taxi to Murano as the boat arrived someone from one of the Glass Factories was waiting for us. He led us directly into the factory and proceeded to show us all sorts of Glass we could buy. We felt completely ambushed!!! The Lobby Bar Terrace on the Grand Canal is a great place for a drink. I would highly recommend it. The hotel staff is good but not great as you would expect. If I go back to Venice I would not stay here again--I would probably go to Hotel Bauer or Luna Bagnioni.

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury”
Reviews.Author: candacegar
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The room was very nice and we had a view of the canal! The staff were wonderful too. We got soaked by the rain while waiting for a water taxi and showed up at this lovely hotel looking just terrible. But, the staff were very friendly and sweet. I highly recommend this hotel though very pricey. But, then everything in Venice is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: southeastfamily
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous and drinks on the terrace are a must. Our room was spacious and spotless--beautiful,bathroom with a great shower and a lovely large room.Decor a bit dated but that added to the charm! Service was very good-concierge especially helpful-recommended a number of restaurants that were excellent without being too pricey. Location is excellent-just tucked out of the way a bit and our room was very quiet. Delightful experience all round-just don't eat at the restaurant, prices really are too high and you will do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Our 45th anniversary, we returned to the site of our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Baltzan
Reviews.Content: The hotel acknowledged our return and our anniversary in many ways. While we were not on the canal we were in room 120 which was lovely and had a huge bathroom. The bar and restaurant are VERY expensive but also very grand. The staff were friendly and helpful ( except for one concierge). This hotel is small and elegant and we would return

Reviews.Title: “A truly great experience.”
Reviews.Author: minsam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent four days at the Gritti Palace and must say it was truly an enjoyable and memorable experience. I believe "experience" is the operative word as you must stay for a while at this hotel to truly soak in, and enjoy, the level of service, the grandeur of the setting and your room accomodations. When checking in we were invited to see several different rooms and then were able to choose the one we liked the most. The service was truly outstanding. I think the staff visited our room at least five times a day or so times a day while were gone and no request was too trivial. The staff was friendly and gracious but acted with a sense of pride that I truly enjoyed. It is close to all of the main attractions and is immediately adjacent to the water bus services. The views from its front deck of the Grand Canal are spectacular. I would recommend this hotel without reservation to anyone who is looking for a first class Venice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Classy elegance with great service”
Reviews.Author: WeybridgeSarah
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wished to treat ourselves as we were going for her 50th birthday and we certainly picked a fabulous hotel. The entrance was very clean and check in was extremely quick. We had a beautiful room which overlooked the canal and although the rooms seem quite old they were looked after, but kept in the style that they should be with long heavy curtains and a magnificent Murano chandelier. We had a very spacious bathroom with a power shower that had several settings and could almost blow you away! Every detail had been thought of. We had complimentary handmade chocolates left for us and the hotel took it upon themselves to leave us a complimentary bottle of bubbly in the room for my friend's birthday which was a lovely touch. The only thing I would say is that the mini bar and room service are very expensive, unless you don't mind paying Â£20 for a bowl of ice cream! The restaurant is equally expensive, although we were recommended a couple of great restaurants in venice by the concierge which were excellent. The thing one must do whilst staying there is a drink in the bar or/and expecially outside on the veranda which is directly on the water where you can see the boats and gondalas pass by. The hotel also have their own jetty to take a water taxi from. A decent glass of chablis premier cru will set you back around Â£12.00 and you get olives and nuts with it so really only London Prices. My overall opinion of the hotel is that it is wonderfully quiet, except for the fact that the boats deliver on the canal side early in the morning so very noisy between 7-8am, otherwise very peaceful. The rooms are large and very elegant. The staff are not obtrusive but very helpful. It is a real treat to go somewhere like this hotel and I would definitely go back. I have stayed in some great hotels and this is one of the best. It is about a 10 minute walk from St Mark's Square but does not feel touristy.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: Aislingt
Reviews.Content: Little to complain about but little to praise. eg 3 coffees last Friday at the lobby -50 euro - smell of sewage very bad - but worse at hotel than outside; Nice room poor bathroom - plastic shower curtain??? underwhelmed ....

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: KentSara
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my birthday and have travelled to Venice many times. Parts of the hotel are lovely but the rooms need updating-desperately! Although clean and tidy and we had a fantastic view they just seem dated and the bathrooms were poor but the staff were fantastic, really friendly, helpful and polite. Not sure that I would stay here again unless it was refurbished which is a shame as the service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Living on past glories”
Reviews.Author: OoiBleach
Reviews.Content: Gracious and expert concierge. But paper thin walls during our 4-day stay made it difficult to sleep at night. The rooms' original grandeur is quite faded, while the decor is decidedly dated and tired. It seems high time for a spiffy refurbishment considering the skyhigh room rates of Euros500+ per night for a standard room. The fact of the Gritti's belonging to Starwood should be hidden, rather than trumpeted on the overly corporate stationery, paper amenities, toiletries. Even though it costs more, it would restore more of the original personality to the hotel. The same could be said of sister hotel, the Danieli, which we visited. Next time, we are likely to stay at the Bauer because it seems better maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Highbridge315
Reviews.Content: Worth every euro, gotta have a martini, sitting on the Grand Canal and just watch everyone going silently by out on the water

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but prefer the Danieli & the Bauer”
Reviews.Author: travelwithkids_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel lived up to our expectations as an historical building and exceptional service. We only spent one day there on Christmas, so hard to judge what it would be like in high season, but found it to be elegant and quiet. The rooms were a good size and had the look of an old world Venitian room, yet were up-to-date as far as the bathrooms. The concierges were very knowledgable and helpful. The only knock was the room service - prices were astronomical for even simple items. In the past we've stayed at the Danieli and Bauer, and would rate this behind both on location and overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gritti Place in Venice, on the Grand canal.”
Reviews.Author: CalienE
Reviews.Content: Wonderful!! Great service and excellent guest rooms. Central to St Marks square and everything of note in Venice. Watch out for the VERY expensive hotel bar , but the food is excellent! The staff are willing to please and very friendly.The restaurant in the giglio square behind the hotel is excellent too!!

Reviews.Title: “Candid, Honest review of "legendary" property”
Reviews.Author: rwingate
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Venice and a stay at the Gritti Palace. I was hesitant to stay here given the prices, although I must admit that I have wanted to visit this property for many years. I have traveled all over the world. And I have experienced some of the best hotels in many countries. I read all the reviews here on this sight for the Gritti Palace and finally here is mine.......Overall anyone staying here for the first time will be a little disappointed. The worldwide reputation is a little outdated to be sure. The hotel rooms and hallways can only be described as - run down and in need to serious renovation. I understand the appeal of staying here. Of course the property is old. I get it. But with these prices I expected a kind of run down chic. At this was not chic at all. It was not "charming" old in any way shape or form. We were given an upgraded room as I am a Platinum Starwood Guest. It was on the top floor at the corner of the building thus giving us 2 windows on to the grand canal. Location was great. But the room was pretty run down in all. I must admit I was surprised to see the very small shower coupled with a cheap plastic shower curtain in the tub. This was in addition to a funny bright yellow "sponge" painted wall color. Kind of strange. The bed was comfortable. The hotel provided a nice fruit basket. Beyond that it was quite a let down. During our stay the hotel was retro fitting an elevator thus it was very noisy during the day. Not noisy at night. At least I can say I stayed there but would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, over-rated and over-priced.”
Reviews.Author: AustenTayshus
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights - Venice itself is a wonderful place to spend a long weekend especially in September when the weather is cooler. We booked a suite expecting for the price Euro 2800 per night to have accommodation overlooking the canal. The first room that we were shown had no view whatsoever apart from the roof of the hotel and surrounding buildings - the second room was marginally better but again with no canal view. The decor in the room was ornate and best described as faded elegance - the bed however was clean and extremely comfortable. A bag of laundry sat uncollected In the corridor outside our room for the duration of our stay. The fruit provided in the room on Day One was not replaced. The restaurant and adjoining bar are small and unappealing - the staff were offhand and the service was slow and unenthusiastic. One of the two lifts was out of order. The terrace area to the front of the hotel bordering the canal is a pleasant spot for lunch if ridiculously overpriced The location of the hotel however is excellent and within comfortable walking distance of all the main attactions and shops. Would I go back to Venice - yes would I stay again at the Gritti - no.

Reviews.Title: “Most Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeff071643
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Gritti Palace Hotel in Venice. We had just come off of a cruise where my husband had what they thought was broncitis. The cruise ended in Venice and then we would fly back to the United States. The hotel had already heard from the the Seabourn that my husband was sick and expedited our room. At 2:00 in the morning my husband was running a high fever with chills. I called the concierge and he immediately sent for the doctor. Since the doctor did not speak any English someone from the hotel came up with him to translate. He ordered stronger medicine and the hotel sent someone to open the pharmacy and get our medicine. He started to feel better and we were able to fly home. It turned out that he had pneumonia. Everyone of the staff at the hotel was outstanding. They couldn't do enough for us. I would recommed this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic first wedding anniversary experience”
Reviews.Author: crispypina
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to the Gritti Palace hotel on our first wedding anniversary weekend, and overall we found it a very good choice. On arrival, though, the receptionist said she was going to send the housekeeper upstairs to check that everything was OK with our room. So we went onto the terrace to have our first drink of our holiday (I had a delicious Longhi fruit juice cocktail). But half an hour later our room was not ready, although it was past 3 pm and check-in time was 2 pm. They said we should wait for another 25 min. and apologized profusely by saying that they were fully booked and the staff were not coping! Not a good enough excuse for a five-star hotel. However, they did seem to be genuinely mortified.
