They asked if we wanted to have a drink on the house, but we had already had one (by the way, they made us pay for it in the end, now that I remember!!!) and it was late, so we went out to have a bite (some fabulous cicchettis at Osteria Dai Zemei, in the San Polo quarter), but we couldn't get changed and my husband suffered from a terrible foot-ache as he wasn't wearing his walking shoes. On our way back, in late afternoon, we were finally shown to our room. We had booked a Gran Deluxe room, but I think that what we got was a Venetian-style room - same price but much smaller. I realized later, but in the end I forgot to ask and in any case the hotel was fully booked, so I donâ€™t think they would have been able to change our room anyway. The room was on the fourth floor, but with no view over Santa Maria del Giglio or anywhere else for that matter - just overlooking the wall and roof of what I think was another part of the hotel. Hardly any sky visible. The bathroom was OK, in need of some sympathetic modernization but quite good overall (and the bathtub was spacious, which we liked!) In the bedroom one of the side lamps wasn't working, but there was enough light, so we didn't mind - the receptionist who accompanied us to our room pointed that out, but nothing was done about it. However, I must say that the furniture was lovely, with antiques and hand-painted wood in pale green and pink hues that created a typical 18th-century Venetian atmosphere, so maybe that was more romantic than another room would have been and partly made up for the smallish size of the room. It was well-kept too. For those who like an elegant and traditional style, like us, this is perfect. But do not go if you are looking for a Marriott-style place. Also, the first night we had no turn-down service as the housekeeper came early, while we were getting ready for dinner, so we told her we'd be gone by 8.30, but she never came back. In spite of having specified in the booking that it was our first anniversary, nothing was done for us, not even a flower or a chocolate in our room, unlike what always happens in certain other hotels. I wasnâ€™t expecting an upgrade or anything so drastic, but a little touch would have been appreciated. And yet... apart from these blips, our overall experience was very good, so much so that weâ€™re ready to go back! And we don't say this very easily. Breakfast on the terrace was fantastic, both in terms of view-atmosphere and of food and drinks. Service was also attentive. Internet service was given free of charge to arrange our online flight check-in. And we absolutely loved the hotel style and dÃ©cor! Location was also strategic, central but quiet. The little wrong details can easily be corrected. We do recommend this hotel for a romantic experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Grande Dame of Venice”
Reviews.Author: French
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel and chose a room overlooking the Grand Canal. Very nice room, maybe not up to the 40 sqm advertised on the spg website, but with extremely large bathroom, filled with many bath products. We had some mosquitoes in the room (and they loved me!!!), but a mosquito plug was available in our cupboard. Internet was working well (against a reasonable fee) Service was excellent and professional, would it be at the reception desk, concierge or at the bar. Enjoying a drink at the bar over the Grand Canal is a wonderful experience! But we still think that the place is rather overpriced... But again, this is the Gritti Palace, one of Venice jewel hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great employee's!”
Reviews.Author: GEORGE92065
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Gritti hotel. We only stayed 2 nights and I wish we were able to stay longer. The concierge were great and very helpful. Our room was beautiful and very large, with a marble bathroom. Our room service was very quick and makes the best coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: ecadams
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at luxury hotels all over the world and this was a disappointment. I was traveling with my two younger sisters and we had a very nice river view suite arranged. When we arrived they put us in a disgusting "suite" with a view of the roof next door, and ceilings that I could touch flat footed. Not to mention the obvious cigarette smoke stains on the cloth walls. When we asked to be moved they acted as if it was a major inconvenience, and I am still not convinced that we were placed in a suite of the same caliber that we had reserved initially. The food was good but overpriced even for a luxury hotel (but the tiramisu was divine), and the cleaning staff entered the room on several occasions despite the 'do not disturb' sign. The front desk staff in general (including the manager) were rude and unaccommodating for no apparent reason.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the Rest”
Reviews.Author: Charmingtoff
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as part of an engagement trip to Venice. The third night was to be at the Cipriani. From the moment you step on to the hotel's "Terrazza Gritti" from a water taxi on the Grand Canal you know that you are entering a world of Venetian splendour. The hotel has managed to keep an authentic Palazzo feel about the place though this is probably due to the fact that the main rooms appear to be in their orginal state of size and decour. Priceless antiques and paintings adourn the hotel. I booked a Venetian room which equals a super deluxe room. To be hyper critical perhaps a little spartan but again full of lovely antique furniture. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. Breakfast on the terrrace (or indeed in the restaurant itself)was divine with the world passing by on the Grand Canal and the June morning sun beaming down on a delicious array of breakfast fare (scrambled egg and parma ham was to die for). The position of the hotel is excellent as my girlfriend had never been to Venice before and i had only spent a day there 28 years ago. The Water Taxis are a bit steep so we got a 24 hour ticket on the water buses. One of the stops is almost next door to the hotel so you can get about very easily on the canals from the hotel. Alternatively all the main sites are easily found on foot. Having done a quick run around its rivals i can honestly say that the Gritti has no serious contendors. If you can afford it the Gritti will give you the most authentic Venetian experience you could want. As if that wasnt enought the hotels bar man makes the best Bellini in town which one can gently sip on the terrace watching all aspects of Venetian life pass you on the Grand Canal. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury at the Gritti!”
Reviews.Author: Chatham
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights this July at this absolutely elegant hotel. It is like living in a museum. The hotel is filled with antiques, and so was our very spacious bedroom (even by American standards) including a Murano chandelier and exquisite mirror. The hotel sits directly on the Grand Canal on a quiet courtyard next to a gondola station; it is very near a vaparetto stop and san marco - easy to get everywhere! Our room faced the court yard and was so quiet that we overslept one morning until 11 am! The bathroom was wonderful with a huge tub; remarkable for such an old structure. The staff was so accommodating; we came early and left late and they were lovely about it all. They are t here for your every need. Be sure to have a cocktail before or after dinner (or both!) at the "patio" directly on the Grand Canal - very romantic. Worth the splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: monkey206
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, my first trip to Venice. I loved this hotel, loads of character. We arrived by private water taxi, which I would well recommend, straight to the door where our bags were collected and taken straight to our rooms. Our room was amazing, typical Venitian style, although no view from the window, but that didn't matter. We were really well looked after. We found Venice to be very expensive but well worth splashing out for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much”
Reviews.Author: UPtraveller1
Reviews.Content: We were here with the entire family. All of our rooms connected on the top floor and I forget how many there were. This hotel is very old and is in need of upgrades. this was our first trip to venice. While the city itself is something to be seen at least once, i would pass on the hotel. The location is fantastic. I believe that if I went again I would try the ciprianni. Hotel room was dirty and had a bad smell. furniture was old and needed to be replaced. Shower was an absolute mess and had to be repaired. The ceiling was leaking on the floor next to the shower, which i think contributed to the foul smell. I was glad when we checked out. Won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Classic 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: captainstuubs
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for our Christmas holiday and couldn't have been more pleased given some of the criticisms of the hotel we read prior to our visit. I can't speak to those reviews be we thoroughly enjoyed or stay. We had a partial canal view room which was very spacious and well appointed. Also the view couldn't be beat--there was a gondolier just below our window. The pros: great location - spectacular views from the restaurant and outside patio; not crowded - because it has fewer rooms that other hotels in Venice you will not find the lobby piled with luggage or huge tour groups; great bar - we had drinks in the bar almost every night and and met some very interesting people with many of the same people each evening --the guests of the hotel tend to be repeat customers who have stayed there for years and were quite friendly). The cons: no deal breakers but here is what I would improve: bathrooms need to be updated - not bad, just dated; breakfast was not up to par with other 5 star hotels (fine but not at a 5 star level). Finally, it is expensive (although with Venice - expensive in its own right - and given that the Gritti is a 5 star hotel this is hardly surprising). Nothing beyond what you would typically expert in a 5 star hotel. All in all, a great and unique place to stay that leaves you feeling that you have left the world of flashy cookie cutter chain hotels behind.

Reviews.Title: “Make a dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: where2nxtmac
Reviews.Content: When trying to decide on a place to stay in Venice I had a very hard time deciding. I narrowed my choices down to The Gritti Palace, The Daniela, and The Bauer Il Palazzo. I am SO ELATED I CHOSE THE GRITTI!!! You may be trying to plan a special trip of a lifetime, as I was. The other hotels are wonderful but, the Gritti has a slight edge above the others. I would say the Gritti's edge is it's staff. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is fantastic! This hotel is the most amazing place to stay in Venice. The location is amazing. Situated on the Grand Canal with amazing views of Venetian life. Within easy walking distance of San Marco Square, world class restaurants and shopping. The Gritti Palace is away from the hordes of tourists. Yet, you can be at all of Venice's major sites on an enjoyable 5 minute stroll from the hotel. The Vaperetto stop is outside door as well a gondola ferry to other side of Grand Canal giving you easy access to Guggenheim, Accedemia and Santa Maria della Salute. The Hotel Staff was incredible,gracious and kind. My mother and I were so pampered and well taken care of we had a hard time adjusting to our hotel in Rome. The Gritti sets the bar high. It is no wonder it is considered one of the best places to stay in the world. From the moment we stepped off our boat on to the Gritti's private launch we were treated like royalty. Our room was absolutely beautiful, exceptionally large and clean. The bathroom was double, perfect for two getting reading comfortably. The hotels restaurant is superb. The food, view and service makes the dining experience devine. If you want to venture out to try other wonderful restaurants in Venice, Umberto and Francesco will send to you to the best!!!! Umberto and Francesco are the Gritti Palace concierge's. They are truly the best. No request is impossible and the heart they have for Venice is translated in the service they give their guests. They treat every guest as a king or queen and make sure that their guests stay in Venice is smooth, enjoyable and unforgettable. Venice is a magical place, The Gritti Palace is a magical hotel. If you want the most amazing true Venetian experience. The Gritti is the place. Stay here at least once in your life!

Reviews.Title: “Staff in Need of Training!”
Reviews.Author: tabby_travels
Reviews.Content: The last time we stayed at the Gritti Palace was in January 2000 and it was nothing short of opulent and divine. This visit was a different story. Maybe it was due to the recent "Aqua Alta" and the staff were in shock but we were aghast at the drop in the quality of the service in the bar/tea room and the breakfast room. Aloof and indifferent would be kind. Cold poached eggs that took forever to arrive, a perfunctory server for High Tea and a tired room made our stay less than it should have been. On the other hand the Concierge was attentive and welcoming. I hope they clean up their act. Next time I think we'll stay at the Danieli whose lobby is a divine place to have drinks and tea - it's like being in a museum exhibit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, full of history”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_7517
Reviews.Content: I and my wife spent 3 nights for a long week-end at Gritti Palace. Our overall experience was very good : - very nice venitian style room under the roof, with partial view of Grand Canal : superb furniture and decoration, very confortable bed - very well located hotel, near San Marco, and very close to Vaporetto station. The terrace of the hotel is directly on the Canal, contrary to most other Starwood hotels in Venice (ex : Danieli) where a lot of tourists are passing by all the day. - very friendly staff in the restaurant, and superb food and wine (a nice compliment from a French guy) I would say that I have this very nice feeling as we have bought a package with a very good value for money. However all published prices (for the room, the breakfast, the dinner, bar, etc....) are not justified, and I can understand the bad feeling of guests who paid full price. The only bad point is for the concierge, who was not very friendly, and also a lack of information in the room about facilities offered by the hotel. Conclusion : highly recommended if a good deal is found !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor!!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiSoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Gritti Palace in 2004 just before the Atens Olympics and I enjoyed the hotel except for the fact that I got stuck in the hotel room bathroom for 2 hours! There was a phone in the bathroom but I was too embarrased to call the front desk and tell them I was stuck! The rooms are filled with beautiful antique paintings, furniture, including bathroom fixtures! I liked my stay there but it was more of a romantic honeymooners hotel. Its right off the main canal and its great to have breakfast in the hotel restaurant because you can sit outside. It was a great hotel if you are looking for that feeling of being in Italy. It has no modern feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Gritti Delightful, but Dine elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: travelfashionista
Reviews.Content: Venice is beautiful any time of the year, and in September can be glorious. Was just there to check out the architecture biennale, and in the hotel fan into a very famous american fashionista who happened to be staying there as well. but no surprise, Gritti attracts a very posh crowd, international, and yet remains still small, chic, and classic. The rooms are delightful little jewel boxes and the beds are a dream. Which is why I was surprised to find the service a bit shabby; the concierge convinced us that a table at one of my favourite restaurants (sorry wont tell!) was booked, and so he booked me at a "family" restaurant which turned out to be the italian cousin of a big greasy US diner. How DARE they mislead us! I thought. Then I realised the concierge had a handful of pre-printed directions on postcards. Ahh, the old kick-back. But at Gritti? FOR SHAME! How dare they subject their clients to such scams? They should protet us, not exploit us. They should know that we chose Gritti because we like wonderful places, and will accept nothing less. So they should only recommend places equal in quality. We know a greasy spoon when we see one! Discriminating world travellers, we instantly phoned a friend who phoned a friend who got us in somewhere (else) that was delightful. On Sunday, had brunch on Gritti terrace, overfussy but decent food. Charming waitstaff and good wines. Only stay there for an apÃ©ro, and book your own dinner reservations. Buon viaggio!

Reviews.Title: “the very top”
Reviews.Author: sebastiaan4norfolk
Reviews.Content: this is just the best place to stay in venice. The staff did everything to make my self and my little dog feel welcome. The food is expensive but it's worth the experience. It isn't cheap but if your looking for a palace hotel this is the one.

Reviews.Title: “the Gritti”
Reviews.Author: reina5087
Reviews.Content: we travelled 1 month in france and Italy. All the places we went to were high end and spectacular. One of my best trips ever, My only disappointment was the Gritti. For that matter my most expensive disappointment. The room was very small, the bathroom a real disappointment. If I'm going to pay 1300 euros a night i expect a little room in the bathroom to leave my toothbrush. Honestly, one of my worst hotel experience. Whether rooms, service,comfort, price, all of it MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT, Did I mention the crazy prices. I was originally booked for the Danielli and changed. When I went to see that hotel I almost started crying. What a gorgeous, spectacullar place. Do yourself a favor STAY AWAY from the Gritti unless you want to get majorly fleeced.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory!”
Reviews.Author: dd-nd
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Gritti Palace after a lovely stay in Rome at The Hotel Eden and a relaxing train journey. Sadly the Gritti was a real disappointment in comparison. We had a Grand Canal view room, which was the single best thing about our stay. On the whole, the hotel was deeply uninspiring. In particular:- 1 Our complimentary bowl of fruit was mouldy. 2 The bathroom was extremely small. 3 The breakfast was one of the most uninspiring 5* breakfasts we have ever had, and the service was appalling, leaving us to clear our own plates. 4 The hotel arranged "free" water taxis to Murano and Burano! The price you pay for this is being subjected to relentless hard sell at the glass factory and also the lace shop. We have only encountered such a hard sell in India - where you expect it! We think this is pretty shabby behaviour from a european 5* hotel. Overall, it is outrageously expensive for what you get. Fantastic location but it is clearly trading on its former glories.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but the most spacious rooms filled with antiques”
Reviews.Author: SBW-Raleigh-NC
Reviews.Content: The Gritti Palace is right on the canal by St Marks Square, so a great location. The rooms are the most spacious, like suites, and filled with lovely antiques, crystal chandeliers, and a beautiful bath. Only complaint was the overpriced food.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand old lady”
Reviews.Author: MrsNP712
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Gritti Palace prior to a further 6 nights at Lake Garda and we could not fault it. Yes, it is an old building but we couldn't really find anything to complain about decor (or aroma) wise. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful without exception. We didn't carry a bag throughout our stay - from the hotel's launch to our room and back. We had a lovely room with a little balcony overlooking the Grand Canal - absolutely perfect. The bathroom had a huge range of complimentary items. We returned to our room on the first night to a bottle of champagne and a large bowl of strawberries-absolutely delicious. We started and ended our day on the balcony, just watching Venice go by. We dined on the terrace on our last night and it was a lovely meal as expected. It was a little breezy and we've never had our photo taken whilst eating before, but if you choose to dine on the terrace of a famous hotel, you have to expect some sort of interest. (I assume that they were actually photographing the hotel, but we just got in the way!). The hotel is a short stroll to all the fantastic designer shops and St Mark's square, but still feels quiet and out of the way. We managed to stroll off the beaten track, well away from the May holiday tourists and saw the 'real' Venice which was fantastic. There are plenty of places to eat with a wide range of prices. We were sad that we didn't have more time to try some of the little restaurants tucked away up many side streets. Overall, we loved Venice and will certainly return to investigate it in more depth.

Reviews.Title: “Too hot by far”
Reviews.Author: paulineclifton
Reviews.Content: Upon reading previous reviews of the Gritti Palace I was concerned enough to return to my travel agent who checked with the Orient Express as I had a package through them.They assured me that they had never had any complaints with the hotel and would not use any hotel that didnt meet their standards. Our transfer was very efficient by the hotels own motor boat. On arrival several members of staff came to deal with our luggage.Check in was quick as was the arrival of our luggage to the room.The room was large,clean and a large bowl of mixed fruit with plates and water bowl were on a table.The decor was splendid,over the top,but it added to the experience.We did not have a view worth having from our windows,our room cost a great deal I dread to think what the price of a room on the Grand Canal would be. The food both at breakfast and dinner were delicious,as was the wine,the cost however was over the top.The view from the dining room was lovely and had the weather been kind to us maybe it would have been worth it to dine on the terrace. Our bathroom was large and clean but more shelving is required to put sponge bag contents on. The hotel had a free boat to the island of Murano and would fetch you back when required.ask at the glass factory to call them. We found all staff to be polite and attentive Now for the big negative.Our room was so hot we could not sleep.We left both the windows wide open but that let the mosquitoes in.Thank goodness I always travel with repellant which I covered myself with.Of course we complained twice but nothing was done.We were told that air conditioning could not be turned on until the 1st May,it was terrible knowing we would not be able to sleep again.The weather for the most part rained I cant imagine what it would have been like if the sun had shone. The location of the hotel was excellent but I would never stop there again as a good nights sleep is important to enjoy the following day.Our most basic requirement of any hotel is to have air conditioning I never dreamed that a hotel of this standard and price would be without it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away its lost its shine”
Reviews.Author: wanderingspoon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed to spend I night in Venice prior to catching the Orient Express in the morning - We are experienced Veniatian travellers having spent 8 weeks visiting one year. We arrived at the Gritti went to reception . I speak enough Italian to introduce my self - I am also a starwood prefered card holder - our reservation was confirmed not much warmth cold but efficientI filled in the forms and then was directed to follow our Staff member to our proposed room -Follow we did carrying our own bags behind our Hotel staff member I asked if the Hotel was full -"Sir the Gritti Palace with 91 Rooms is always full because the hotel is Famous" so came the reply The door was unlocked and we where led into the room - this is one of bigger rooms with a view of the canal - we where told Well here we are back in venice its 6 pm we leave at 9 Oclock following morning-Lets look at the view 450euro I s'pose the starwood card must have some qudos- Sorry what view -Oh you mean the one from the second window -you stand on the stool first and look to the left -yes it is water- whats that smell Its near the desk -Come one its an old hotel a bit of mold wont kill you- Well we had a great evening in Venice -Following day we carried our bags to check out past the bellboy polishing the marble floor paid our bill and left the famous hotel never ever to return again -Save your money its obsolete -The staff are not interested -reviews are right dont do it

Reviews.Title: “Glad we did it, but won't do it again.”
Reviews.Author: Rover4
Reviews.Content: We've been visiting Venice for twenty-five years and were aware of the Gritti but had never stayed there. This year we decided to splurge in celebration of our fortieth anniversary. We read the reviews on TripAdvisor, many of which are not complimentary of the hotel, but we decided to go anyway. We found the less-than-favorable reviews to be accurate. Yes, we were staying in an historic property with lovely furnishings and a beautiful setting, but no, it did not live up to our expectations. If there is air conditioning, it was not working. We had to sleep with the windows open, but we were still too warm to sleep. Mosquitoes buzzing in our ears made it worse. Our room was furnished with handsome antiques and elegant linens, but the carpet was worn, soiled, and needed replacing. The marble bathroom was lovely, but we found it cramped for two people, and housekeeping was quite frugal with the toiletries. Our rate of over $800 per night did not include breakfast, which would have been Euro 60 (more than $80.00 each) additional. To the hotel's credit, they did deliver flowers to our room on the day of our anniversary, a lovely and unexpected gesture. The staff is also to be commended for their friendliness. But in a city of great hotels, it just doesn't make sense to pay so much and get so little. Reserve at the Gritti if you must, but don't be surprised at the end of your stay if you're reminded of the old song, "Is that all there is?"

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kis777
Reviews.Content: I thought our stay at the Gritti Palace was very good. We had a nice big room with the views of the canal and Salute. It's not loud at night, as opposed to some hotels on the main square. The service was good. We were there for the carnaval and they have a nice store on premises where you can rent fun costumes. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Gritti Palace.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a choice do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: RMG66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 20th anniversary with a trip to Italy and it was wonderful! I planned this trip in great part using the opinions presented on this website, and I will tell you they are pretty accurate. We visited Rome, Florence and Venice and we stayed at Starwood properties in each city as we were using Star points. The hotel choices in each city were our biggest concern and the decisions were pretty clear cut in Rome (The St. Regis Grand was EXCELLENT!) and in Florence (the Westin Excelsior was beyond EXCELLENT!). However, in Venice the reviews of the 4 major Starwood properties were all over the board from great to down right horrendous! It was not an easy decision by any means and in fact I canceled and changed the reservation two times before leaving the states! Most of the major tour books on Italy mention the Gritti Palace as one of the best places to stay in the city, but the Tripadvisor reviews were pretty dismal at times so after initially booking the Gritti I bailed and booked into the Westin Europa and Regina. Then, as our trip grew nearer I started to panic and think I may have this once in a lifetime opportunity to stay at this legendary hotel on points that all these books are raving about, and I am going to blow it because of a few poor reviews! So, I canceled the Westin and booked back into the Gritti. Well, WHAT A MISTAKE! I cannot express to you the disappointment in this hotel. It is the highest of all point levels in the Starwood system and it is totally over rated and misrepresented! I have no complaints with the staff, they were not as warm as either of the Westin properties, but they were courteous and attentive none the less. It is 100% the rooms I have a complaint with. The room we were given actually was an upgrade as it had a pretty nice view of the canal through the window, but that was the only redeeming quality of the room. It was cold in it's decor, not warm and inviting as other European hotels we have had the pleasure of staying. The television was sitting on top of the mini-bar/fridge--it just looked tacky. The single piece of upholstered furniture was a tattered and stained wing back chair that looked like it was from my grandmother's attic! There was a lovely Murano chandelier, the bathroom was marble, and the room was generally clean.--but a few niceties amidst mostly sub par decor and amenities do not constitute a luxury room. The point of my complaint is this--it is not a tier 7 hotel!!! It is not a five star hotel!!! Who regulates these systems? Perhaps the Gritti Palace has some lovely suites for over $1,000 a night that the average traveler will never see, but I am here to tell you there are much lovelier rooms to be had in Venice for far fewer points and for a lot less cash. Even the common areas we saw at the Gritti were in my opinion dark and confining, not necessarily luxurious and inviting. I realize I am rambling at this point so I will close with this--we asked to be moved to another Starwood property within a few hours of checking into the Gritti and they kindly and efficiently accommodated us. We were able to get a room using fewer points at the Westin Europa and Regina on the SPG floor. There was no view at all from the room, but it was well worth the sacrifice because the room was plush, lovely and comfortable! There is absolutely no comparison room to room between these two properties! I want everyone to understand however, the personnel at both properties were accommodating and gracious to us and I have only glowing things to report about Starwood in general. The final thought I want to impress upon those studying this site for a future trip--I suggest you choose the advice of your fellow traveler over the printed guide books you may read because it has been my experience first hand that the people who invest the time on this site have experienced the "real deal" at the places they visit and report just that, as opposed to perhaps a sugar coated experience a professional author or book contributor may get when they experience that same place. Happy traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel Gritti Palace”
Reviews.Author: VenetianLady
Reviews.Content: This was my 12th visit to the Hotel Gritti Palace. Every year my husband & I travel to Italy. We have been all over Italy, but always return to Venice & The Hotel Gritti Palace. The hotel has changed over the years, in some ways better and some some ways worse. Twice we had grand rooms overlooking the Grand Canal, but that is very costly now. The Venetian rooms, decorated in a grand style, but no view made me claustrophic. I suggest a room overlooking Campo Giglio. The Hotel is very well located. Breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Grand Canal and the Salute is one of the most wonderful places to be. Dinner at the Club Del Doge is very, very expensive, and this year we chose not to dine there. The front desk is very helpful. It was interesting that like a previous comment, we were not met at the dock when we arrived, which was highly unusual. The concierges, Guiliano, Francesco, Umberto and Marcello, as always, are professional and helpful. Take advantage of the free Ciga boat to Lido. You can visit the beach or for a fee use the Excelsior or Hotel Des Bains pool. Service & housekeeping are impeccable. One major complaint is that there is a CHARGE FOR INTERNET SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: “So sad to see an icon slip”
Reviews.Author: edrAlexandria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is as gorgeous from the water as ever, and the public rooms historic and lovely as always, but our experience as "guests" there was very disappointing. Our room had a fantastic view, looking out over the Grand Canal, and watching and listening to the water traffic below our open windows was a delightful experience. However. Our first inkling that this old place had seriously slipped was not being met by anyone to help haul our bags up from the water taxi stop at the hotel's entrance. It wasn't just a moment's inattention - no one is stationed on the water side to help guests arriving or leaving with their bags. Upon being shown to our room, we immediately became aware that the air conditioning was barely functioning; the bed was comfortable but neither of us slept particularly well during our stay of several nights due to the warmth of the room. The most perplexing - and aggravating - problem, however, was the small, sadly outdated bathroom. Sheathed in marble, it sat two large steps up from the room behind an odd door cut from the wall, and contained a skinny plastic-lined tub with one hand-held shower head, a toilet and bidet squeezed alongside two sides of the tub, a small sink and a very small table/stand. Over the years the marble in the bathroom has absorbed cigarette smoke, so the odor of stale smoke is the first thing we noticed each time we opened the door. I handwashed a silk teeshirt and hung it to dry overnight in the bathroom which was a mistake; the teeshirt smelled of stale smoke the next day. My husband's complaints to the management were met with polite indifference. We were very sorry to have paid the Gritti's extremely expensive rates for such a disappointing experience and hope others don't make our mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, mediocre room, and very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Keith045
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in the Hotel Gritti wandering through Venice, which is a beautiful city. We arrived here and took a water taxi to the hotel, which at 50 Euros, was a bit of a shock (I'd suggest the water busses called Vaporetti). It's a pretty hotel and very impressive when you walk in the lobby. Unfortunately, our room was only a bit larger than our large bathroom and we ended up with two small twin beds that reminded me of my teenage years. The bathroom was nicely laid out and large and in pretty good shape although some of the towel holders were breaking (Venice's decaying charm?). The concierge desk was very helpful and overall the service for the hotel was great. But watch out for the painfully expensive room service. 18 Euros for a fruit bowl!!!! Although the overall experience wasn't bad I'd expect a lot more from a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: patroh
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is without doubt the best in Venice, Some might say the hotel is not worth the money,, but when you stay at the Gritti you don't complain about the price. The hotel lobby is quaint with a nice Venetian heir to it, the rooms are a good size but beautiful and extravigantly furnished with beautiful antiques, but withot doubt the highlight of our three night stay was the restaurant, which however expensieve, was some of the best food we ever had eating there on the last two nights of our stay. For anyone put off by the other reviews, Ignore them!!! I Would not hesitate stay in this dream hotel again, and will be returning soon!!

Reviews.Title: “High hopes but complete let down...”
Reviews.Author: wanderingstar68
Reviews.Content: Booked three nights at the Gritti Palace in May for husbands 40th and set off with high hopes. Location is fab but that turned out to be all. Our room was pretty but always cold. Staff had confirmed to me a booking for Cips restaurant at the Cipriani for the special birthday lunch on Sunday and when we arrived it wasn't even open!! Didn't care when I relayed back that we had to eat at the Cipriani pool bar surrounded by people in spa robes. Upon checking out my husband was verbally assaulted by a staff member shouting that we had left "clothes all over the room" when we had left our bags packed and closed for the concierge to collect. By genuine accident I had left a blouse and a bikini in a drawer but these were not returned to us and when I realised them missing we were charged 60 euro for their return. This was subsequently repaid after my travel agent stepped in but the whole experience was very upsetting and the front of house staff we met were both rude and inefficient.

Reviews.Title: “A Dying Legend!”
Reviews.Author: francescaBannerElkNc
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to be returning to Venice and the Gritti for my 7th visit. Unfortunately this will be the last stay at the Gritti. We booked a Grand Luxe room with large marble bathroom. The room was on the first floor directly across from the elevator. The furniture was Venetian style and fine, however the only easy chair and draperies were awful, worn and the color certainly didn't go with anything else in the room. There was no a/c or ventilation in the "large marble bathroom" and you cannot adjust the room's thermostat! The concierge staff is still the best, but cannot say the same for reception. The bar service was fine, but the quality of the drinks was horrible. They give a bellini a bad name!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but for happy fews only”
Reviews.Author: bjouve
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this hotel. The location is very good, in the heart of Venice. The building is good looking and the staff ok. However, one would expect much larger rooms for a palace. Rates are simply outrageous (eg â‚¬55 for a very basic breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Have a drink don't stay”
Reviews.Author: MQS007
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Gritti a number of times over the years. While the hotel is FINE....it is not great. There are many hotels in Venice that are as good or better and cheaper. The hotel is resting on its old reputation (which is no longer is supportable). Floor is laminent fake wood to replace the old parquet.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly a palace”
Reviews.Author: PaLovetotravel
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 other couples visited Venice in the Fall. We chose The Gritti Palace for several reasons. It is a Starwood property and although we paid for our rooms and top dollar at that ,we still received Starwood points. Another reason were the pictures in the Starwood brochure as well as numerous travel website recommendations. I have to say the location on the Grand Canal is absolutely gorgeous but the hotel itself may have been a palace, but no longer. The lobby was small but well appointed. The staff was very gracious. We paid 1400. us dollars per night and the rooms were cheesy at best. Do yourself a favor and stay at another property and have a drink on the canal at the restaurant. It is definitely not worth the money especially the price for a weekend in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “That was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Gemmadimare
Reviews.Content: We traveled from US to Madrid,Montecarlo then our last stop was Venice.The lobby nice and so was the front desk person, if you want to experience a real old style Venitian hotel then this is the one for you. It has not undergone refurbishment in the same way as other 5 star Veinice hotels, but has retained its old style ambience. We had a great Carneval holiday with an up graded room and several free gifts from the management. The restaurant food did compare to the meals we had in the Hotel de Paris (Montecarlo) (equivalent star rating)...delicious!!! When visiting Venice, do not hesitate, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: MPF&SJF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Gritti Palace for two nights in January. We were going to book a Venetian Room but opted for a Grand Delux as it was a larger room. I will be totally honest.... the room was not what I expected, I have stayed in many 5 star hotels so I have good idea on what to expect. However, the room was large, very clean and was nicely furnished, but there was something missing, it did not feel lavish and it lacked character, It did not feel there was any age or history to the room and that is what I was hoping for. The floor was laminated wood (or something similar), not what I expected at all. The bathroom was very clean but very dated, definitely not what I expect from a five star, it was very "seventies". We thought we had got a really good deal paying 810 euros for two nights as the photos on the hotel website portray very richly furnished rooms, but you would need to be paying a lot more than we did to expect the standard of rooms portrayed. The rest of the hotel is fantastic and cannot be faulted, very lavish, the staff were very friendly and very helpful. Drinks and food are very expensive but this is to be expected in a five star hotel, although 55 euros for the childrens menu is a bit excessive for pasta, burger and an ice cream! We arrived by private water taxi to the hotel (cost - 100 euros) which I would recommend as it was a lovely way to arrive as the hotel is right on the Grand Canal. Very impressive sights! Overall we had a fantastic time, Venice is a wonder place! The Gritti Palace is a lovely hotel in a great location, I was hoping for a fantastic room but if I was to stay again I would have to pay much more if I wanted something really lavish!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful palazzo hotel”
Reviews.Author: WJSLondon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights at the Gritti over Christmas. We booked a "grand luxe" room through our travel agent who found us a deal at 435 EUR per night including buffet breakfast. We consider this to have been excellent value .Our room had large double windows overlooking the quiet square with a partial water view. It was a typical Venetian- decorated room- flounces,painted furniture,gilding, Murano glass with panelling and moulding covering every wall and the ceiling too. It had every modern amenity that we needed in a riotously decorated setting- the room could have only been in a palazzo in Venice. The bed was extraordinarily comfortable too. Housekeeping was of a good standard and invisible throughout our stay. We cannot understand some of the comments about the hotel's public rooms- it is full of antiques and parts date back to the 15th century. An antique mirror which needs re-silvering can hardly be described as "tired" ( or maybe the complainer was referring to old marble floors ?) We were not at all surprised to discover that an English duke was staying at the Gritti when we were- he owns a very well known palace himself . Maybe your correspondents would find that "tired" too. We found the staff from bellhops to barman to concierges extremely warm and helpful . We ate one meal in the restaurant which was good if a little lacking in ambience. We drank in the bar where the barman mixes a mean grog. The concierges are very knowledgeable and helped us find concerts and restaurants with equal success. ( they did not go for the simple options either) . When a museum would not honour our pass for getting straight to the head of the queue and we mildly mentioned it on our return the duty manager himself came to apologise and telephoned the museum to remonstrate. All in all a wonderful and memorable break with nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Why complain about the cost?”
Reviews.Author: buccsmf1
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why people go to a 5 star hotel in one of the more expensive cities in Italy and complain that they have to pay $100 per plate at their nicest restaurant or $30 for a hamburger on their restaurant on the water..... For around $800 per night we were in a beautiful room with a huge balcony overlooking the square to the side of the building, including a partial water view. The staff was extremely polite, we were there for 6 nights and many of them new my name by heart by the time I left. Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff, definetly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but..”
Reviews.Author: winebuyer
Reviews.Content: The location is the best in Venice, and the staff is excellent. But parts of the hotel are more than a bit tired, business services are lacking, and, the brochure descibes breakfast on the terrace as "magical". We would agree; extracting 100 euros from a couple for that breakfast is magic! But not quite to the level of charging 20 Euros for french fries from room service.

Reviews.Title: “The Gritti's a mixed-bag.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For over $700 a night I had expected opulence and top notch service. I was supremely disappointed on both counts. I think the reason for the great divergence of opinion in these reviews is that the rooms in the ancient section (facing the canal) are grandiose though somewhat shabby, while those in the "new" section are furnished like a Super-8 Motel and face a stinking canal and the wall of a neighboring building. My room there was none too immaculate, as well. Also, the concierge was condescending and indifferent. In all, the Gritti is Grimy.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Venice in winter, Christmas at the Gritti: it doesn't get much better than this. A sociologist could have a field day analyzing the wide range of visitors' responses to the Gritti. For me the key to the experience of staying there is the perfect balance between luxury and low-key comfort. Sometimes I think of it as a bed and breakfast where the guest list just happens to include heads of state. But if you show how much you appreciate the calm style of the Gritti you will be treated as beautifully as anyone else. It's not the Ritz. It's the Gritti. Ruskin loved it. Proust loved it. And you will, too. I hope it stays the same.

HotelInfo.Name: The Gritti Palace
HotelInfo.Address: Campo Santa Maria del Giglio 2467, 30124 Venice, Italy
